unnormalised: Pune, Maharashtra – Accurate inventory forecasting is becoming increasingly critical for Indian manufacturers aiming to optimize their supply chains and remain competitive. A recent study by IIM Ahmedabad highlights how improved forecasting techniques can reduce waste and improve efficiency, leading to significant cost savings.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, a lead researcher on the project, explains that leveraging data analytics and machine learning helps predict demand fluctuations more accurately than traditional methods. This is especially crucial during festival seasons like Diwali, when demand for certain goods can surge.

unnormalised: Better forecasts mean companies like Tata Steel can minimize storage costs by holding only the necessary inventory. Warehouses, often measured in sq ft, can be utilized more effectively. Proper inventory management also prevents stockouts, ensuring customers in places like Chennai and Kolkata receive their orders on time. The report estimates potential savings of Rs. 50 Lakh annually for a medium-sized manufacturing unit adopting these advanced techniques. It is a critical area, impacting not just profits but also the overall economic health of the sector. This allows reallocation of capital towards R&D and expansion.
